Milt,

Jinsoo Kim told me that the best way to care for the old iron 
sukashi pieces I have is to simply rub them now and then with a soft 
silk cloth.  I have read the various prescriptions for cleaning, 
waxing, etc... and, as I've mentioned, I am quite the novice and so 
am in the dark as to what the current thinking on this is.  The 
tsuba I have are all in excellent condition, with only minimal spots 
of light surface rust in some of the sukashi openings, and none on 
the plate or rim.  Again, I appreciate your thoughts on this, and am 
gradually coming to a view that if I'm in doubt, do nothing!  

Thanks again,

Steve
